Sam sat alone in his small, dimly lit room, the walls closing in around him. The silence was oppressive, a heavy blanket pressing down on his chest. He had been here before, in this place of despair, but today felt different. Today, the darkness seemed to seep into his very bones.

His hands trembled as he reached for the bottle of pills he kept hidden under his bed. Each pill represented a small step towards an escape from the pain, each one a promise of relief. But today, something was different. Today, he considered a method that felt more final, more intense.

He stood up, his movements slow and deliberate, and walked over to the window. The night air was cold, a stark contrast to the warmth of the sun during the day. He pulled back the curtain, revealing the dark expanse of the sky above.

From his pocket, he took out a small, sharp object—a pocket knife. His fingers traced the blade, feeling its edge against his skin. The knife was a symbol of control, a tool to exert some semblance of power in a world that felt out of control.

He moved closer to the window, his eyes fixed on the distant trees. The knife was held steadily, the blade glinting in the moonlight. He thought about the sensation of the cold metal against his skin, the way it would cut through the pain and the fear.
